actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 103-662.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 359.
Mr. Sharp moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Renewable Energy.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Renewable Energy, Energy Efficiency, and Competitiveness

official_title: To reauthorize appropriations for the weatherization program under section 422 of the Energy Conservation and Production Act.

summary.text: Amends the Energy Conservation and Protection Act to extend the authorization of appropriations for the weatherization assistance program for low-income persons through FY 1996.

titles.title: To reauthorize appropriations for the weatherization program under section 422 of the Energy Conservation and Production Act.
